This is a prerequisite for showing when diagonal matrices are positive definite.

Missed from #13748

Oops, I reviewed the other one first, can you see my comment there relevant to this bit? (I'm on mobile so it's harder to copy)

Pull request successfully merged into master.

Build succeeded:
  * [Build](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/9601766104/job/26481036779)
  * [Lint style](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/9601766104/job/26481036586)

> Am I right that in this generality you could get the related but different result where the hypothesis on a is nonnegativity and regularity and the conclusion is regularity?
>
> If so, do you mind adding it?

I'm not really sure how that would follow; can you give the statement you're thinking of, once you're not on mobile?

The statement I was originally thinking of is trivially true, and doesn't require positivity:
```lean
import Mathlib.Algebra.Star.Order

variable {R : Type*} [NonUnitalSemiring R] [PartialOrder R] [StarRing R] [StarOrderedRing R]

example {a : R} (ha : 0 ≤ a) (ha' : IsRegular a) {c : R} (hc : IsRegular c) : IsRegular (star c * a * c) :=
  isRegular_mul_and_mul_iff.mpr ⟨(isRegular_mul_and_mul_iff.mpr ⟨hc.star, ha'⟩).1, hc⟩ |>.1
```
But I believe what I was actually wanting is something more along the lines of: if `a : R` is left-regular, then `star a * a` is regular.

However, even though it's true in C⋆-algebras (easy to see but complicated proof: represent the C⋆-algebra on a Hilbert space, notice that left-regularity corresponds to injectivity, and recall that `star a * a` and `a` have the same kernel; then `star a * a` is self-adjoint and left-regular, hence regular), I don't see how to get it in this generality. With it, one would hope to generalize my example above to `IsLeftRegular c` (and that seems hopeless too because we can't actually write `a = star b * b` because of our definition of `StarOrderedRing`), but oh well.

In any case, unless you see something I don't with the above, we'll just skip it for this PR.

pullRequest.title: [Merged by Bors] - feat: `0 < c * a * star c` in `StarOrderedRing`s
